p: We agree that the cell-type specific impacts could be either primary or secondary, and are likely to be driven by complex interactions between cell-autonomous and non-cell autonomous signaling. Examining the impact of MIA on specific neuronal and glial populations (including interneurons) has been a focus of other published studies that we reference. We hope our findings spur further future work. We also agree that this should be referred to as progenitor maturation, and updated the text accordingly. The text below from the Discussion now addresses this point:
